meanings.definition: To prevent or hinder something from happening.
meanings.sent1: She forefends any danger by locking the door at night.
meanings.sent2: The fence forefends the rabbits from entering the garden.
meanings.sent3: He forefends the rain by carrying an umbrella everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The scarecrow forefends the crows with its menacing appearance.
meanings.sent5: The knight forefends the kingdom from invaders with his sword and shield.

meanings.definition: To defend or protect against something.
meanings.sent1: The brave dog forefends its owner from any harm.
meanings.sent2: The antivirus software forefends the computer from viruses.
meanings.sent3: The superhero forefends the city from villains with his superpowers.
meanings.sent4: The fortress forefends the kingdom from enemy attacks.
meanings.sent5: The vaccine forefends the population from deadly diseases.
